extendedIngredients.name: cherry tomatoes
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 cups fresh cherry tomatoes, sliced in half

extendedIngredients.name: olive oil
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 tablespoons Arbequina Pompeian Olive Oil, divided

extendedIngredients.name: tortellini
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 package (9 ounces) tortellini - any variety (I use cheese)

recipes.title: Balsamic Tomato Tortellini

winePairing.pairingText: No one wine will suit every pasta dish. Pasta in a tomato-based sauce will usually work well with a medium-bodied red, such as a montepulciano or chianti. Pasta with seafood or pesto will fare better with a light-bodied white, such as a pinot grigio. Cheese-heavy pasta can pair well with red or white - you might try a sangiovese wine for hard cheeses and a chardonnay for soft cheeses. We may be able to make a better recommendation if you ask again with a specific pasta dish.

recipes.instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F.  Line a rimmed baking sheet with nonstick foil (or spray foil with cooking spray).Toss sliced tomatoes and garlic with 1 tablespoon olive oil.  Pour in a single layer onto prepared baking sheet.  Cook for 25 to 30 minutes, or until tomatoes soften and garlic browns (watch carefully so it doesn't burn).Meanwhile cook tortellini according to package directions.  Drain and put into serving bowl.In a small bowl, mix remaining olive oil and balsamic vinegar until combined.Pour roasted tomatoes and garlic over tortellini, toss gently to combine. Pour olive oil/balsamic vinegar mixture over tomatoes and toss to coat.  Top with fresh Parmesan cheese and/or crushed red pepper, as desired.

steps.step: Preheat oven to 425°F.  Line a rimmed baking sheet with nonstick foil (or spray foil with cooking spray).Toss sliced tomatoes and garlic with 1 tablespoon olive oil.

Pour in a single layer onto prepared baking sheet.  Cook for 25 to 30 minutes, or until tomatoes soften and garlic browns (watch carefully so it doesn't burn).Meanwhile cook tortellini according to package directions.
Drain and put into serving bowl.In a small bowl, mix remaining olive oil and balsamic vinegar until combined.
Pour roasted tomatoes and garlic over tortellini, toss gently to combine.
Pour olive oil/balsamic vinegar mixture over tomatoes and toss to coat.  Top with fresh Parmesan cheese and/or crushed red pepper, as desired.
